column5: We were paying 30 per case until last year and they raised it to 40 a case we are in northern saskatchewan so probably not a bad deal as a lot of flights to get to camp. Atlanta Dave
You can bring a case per person, all you do is claim the other two and then stop and pay the duty.

FishTwentyFourSeven What is the name of the other major beer/liquor store? We like to use them because they accept Credit Cards. Last time I went to the beer store, which was a while ago, they only took cash from us. thanks in advance for the help.
If you mean in Canada, I think it's LCBO.
>If you mean in Canada, I think it's LCBO. FishTwentyFourSeven that is it...thank you.
The Beer Store also accepts credit cards now.

>We buy cans at duty free for $13 and pay I think $6 per case >over(duty)making a total of $19 American. If your outfitter >flys it in pay for the overweight and still save?? Large >bottle of Crown is $18!! What is the name of the duty free store? Is it Bob's?

42 US dollars if he's selling it to you

Most Canadian Beer has a price set by the province. However, there are cheaper brands such as some of the U.S. beer that is sold in canada such as Old Mill. Lucky Lager is a good one! Canadian Strong at 5% and 24 cans will run you about $26 Canadian (just over $20 U.S.)
yeah, i think you made my point better than i did! thanks jerry

We buy cans at duty free for $13 and pay I think $6 per case over(duty)making a total of $19 American. If your outfitter flys it in pay for the overweight and still save?? Large bottle of Crown is $18!!
Thanks for all the info - I was jsut curious, we are going to forge ahead. I like the analogy of price per can in the woods versus the Sports Bar.

I love beer and sometimes you just have to pay the price for something you like. But I buy the bottom end beer price most of the time( Miller High Life). And when I'am not sharing I buy some good stuff. I can drink it all price or name. And I like all the beer from Canada and not to knock it. But I can not tell much diff. in our cheap beer here in the USA from the cheap beer in Canada. Sleeman Ale taste the same in Florida as it does in Emo Ont. to me. It is all good some better than others. Besides you just rent the beer for a couple of hours and get rid of it. I support the recycle program. Good luck My 3 fav. types of beer 1) Cold beer 2) Free beer 3) Your beer
Do you have to buy your beer at the duty free place to pay the $6 penalty per case or can I bring 3 cases over the border and pay the penalty on 2 of them?
don't forget that that fee includes deposit - and - DO NOT crush the cans. rinse them out, put them back into the case and give them to someone at your flying service as an additional tip. phish
don't forget that that fee includes deposit - and - DO NOT crush the cans. rinse them out, put them back into the case and give them to someone at your flying service as an additional tip. phish
? Explain phish
? Explain phish

jigman - beer cans in ontario are all returnable for deposit and the beer stores will not accept crushed cans. we always box them back up and give them to dock hands who make pretty good money returning them. - phish

jigman - beer cans in ontario are all returnable for deposit and the beer stores will not accept crushed cans. we always box them back up and give them to dock hands who make pretty good money returning them. - phish

24 bottles (341 ml) of Labatts Blue runs about $28.50 US while 24 cans (355 ml) of Labatts Blue is about $32.25 US. Return per bottle/can is about 10 cents Cdn. You can check out beer prices in Canada at The Beer Store web site - see http://www.thebeerstore.ca/

24 bottles (341 ml) of Labatts Blue runs about $28.50 US while 24 cans (355 ml) of Labatts Blue is about $32.25 US. Return per bottle/can is about 10 cents Cdn. You can check out beer prices in Canada at The Beer Store web site - see http://www.thebeerstore.ca/

$42 US is what we paid on a fly-in 2 years ago. As someone else said, the outfitter should be expected to get some compensation for buying it, paying the deposit, and flying it to wherever you're going. It seems high, but if you put it in perspective, it's $1.75/bottle for LaBatts Blue in the Canadian wilderness. I paid $3.50/bottle for Miller Lite at a sports bar last weekend.

I'm plannng a Fly-In trip to canada in May and the outfitter said the cost of a case of beer was $42 US Dollar. Is that right, just seems high.

A case of 24 cans should run you about 40 cdn dollars. 24 bottles will be just over 36 cdn.
A case of 24 cans should run you about 40 cdn dollars. 24 bottles will be just over 36 cdn.

I wouldn't recommend the bottles if flying in. The added weight is unnecessary for the flight. Also, glass in the wilderness is a huge forest fire concern. Cans can be crushed and packed out easier than bottles as well. I hope that helps.

I wouldn't recommend the bottles if flying in. The added weight is unnecessary for the flight. Also, glass in the wilderness is a huge forest fire concern. Cans can be crushed and packed out easier than bottles as well. I hope that helps.
my guess is that includes the extra cost to fly it in. my opinion: i doubt the guy is getting rich selling beer, its your vacation just pay the price and get on with life. jerry
my guess is that includes the extra cost to fly it in. my opinion: i doubt the guy is getting rich selling beer, its your vacation just pay the price and get on with life. jerry

Last year a case of Labatts from our outfitter was $39 I believe. That's American. That's the same cost as in the beer store (I think). Yeah, it's a little costly. However, it's real beer. Drink six of those Canadian Labatts and you got a real shine on. Drink 6 American Labatts and you're just a little happy. IMHO-the Canadian beer is worth it. We usually bring our case of beer per man from home, but then buy at least 2 cases per four guys of Canadian beer.
